articles.headline: At First Debate, a Glimpse of Trumpism Without Trump
articles.snippet: At times onstage, Republican rivals could imagine the primary race was about issues, ideology and biography. Then reality set in.
articles.abstract: At times onstage, Republican rivals could imagine the primary race was about issues, ideology and biography. Then reality set in.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was, for 57 minutes, a glimpse into a post-Trump Republican Party.

articles.headline: Blast Likely Downed Jet and Killed Prigozhin, U.S. Officials Say
articles.snippet: The officials stressed that multiple theories about what brought down a plane in Russia were still being explored. President Putin acknowledged the incident and spoke about Yevgeny Prigozhin in the past tense.
articles.abstract: The officials stressed that multiple theories about what brought down a plane in Russia were still being explored. President Putin acknowledged the incident and spoke about Yevgeny Prigozhin in the past tense.
articles.lead_paragraph: An explosion on a plane believed to be carrying the Russian mercenary leader Yevgeny V. Prigozhin likely brought down the aircraft on Wednesday, killing all the passengers aboard, according to U.S. and other Western officials citing preliminary intelligence.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Helene Cooper, Eric Schmitt, Riley Mellen, Muyi Xiao and Robin Stein

articles.headline: Proposal to Expand Political Betting Could Up the Ante on Control of Congress
articles.snippet: A New York exchange wants to allow high-dollar trading on the partisan divide on Capitol Hill, but lawmakers and watchdogs worry it could undermine public confidence in elections.
articles.abstract: A New York exchange wants to allow high-dollar trading on the partisan divide on Capitol Hill, but lawmakers and watchdogs worry it could undermine public confidence in elections.
articles.lead_paragraph: Handicapping control of Congress is always a risky proposition, with multiple forces at work and much at stake in terms of policy and power. Now tens of millions of dollars could be riding on the outcome of House and Senate races as well.

articles.headline: Trump Surrenders at Atlanta Jail in Georgia Election Interference Case
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump spent about 20 minutes at the jail, getting fingerprinted and having his mug shot taken for the first time in the four criminal cases he has faced this year.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump spent about 20 minutes at the jail, getting fingerprinted and having his mug shot taken for the first time in the four criminal cases he has faced this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former President Donald J. Trump surrendered at the Fulton County jail in Atlanta on Thursday and was booked on 13 felony charges for his efforts to reverse his 2020 election loss in Georgia.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset, Danny Hakim and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: This Is Public Housing. Just Don’t Call It That.
articles.snippet: Montgomery County, Md., like many places, has an affordable housing crisis. So it started acting like a benevolent real estate investor.
articles.abstract: Montgomery County, Md., like many places, has an affordable housing crisis. So it started acting like a benevolent real estate investor.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Laureate is one of those apartment buildings that developers love to build and anti-gentrification types love to hate. Marketed as “inspired living,” it sits outside Washington, D.C., across the street from a Starbucks and a short walk from the Metro’s red line. The boxy frame and clean lines mark it as a haven for young professionals, and it is part of an effort by Montgomery County, Md., to turn a former industrial area with a bus yard into a high-cost insta-neighborhood.

articles.headline: Hawaii Wildfires Spur Insurers to Reassess the State’s Risk
articles.snippet: Hawaii has long been a low-risk and profitable market for insurers, but the Maui disaster could change that, and even have a global ripple effect.
articles.abstract: Hawaii has long been a low-risk and profitable market for insurers, but the Maui disaster could change that, and even have a global ripple effect.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just days after the Maui fires, Roy Wright, the head of an insurance industry-funded research organization, began mobilizing a team.
articles.byline: By Santul Nerkar and Emily Flitter

articles.headline: With Prigozhin’s Death, Putin Projects a Message of Power
articles.snippet: The Kremlin appears to be sending the signal that no degree of effectiveness can protect someone from punishment for disloyalty.
articles.abstract: The Kremlin appears to be sending the signal that no degree of effectiveness can protect someone from punishment for disloyalty.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just as the news broke on Wednesday of the presumed death of the mercenary chief Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was presiding over a televised World War II anniversary ceremony on a dark stage lit dramatically in red.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Valerie Hopkins

articles.headline: Among the 388 Listed as Missing in Maui: Survivors Lost in the Paperwork
articles.snippet: Hawaii officials released their first list of missing people, prompting friends — and even some of those named — to come forward with their whereabouts.
articles.abstract: Hawaii officials released their first list of missing people, prompting friends — and even some of those named — to come forward with their whereabouts.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fire that leveled Lahaina burned so hot that officials said some victims’ bodies were turned to ash and may never be recovered or identified.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs

articles.headline: Fed Chair’s Message Is Clear: The Fight Against Inflation Isn’t Over
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell, the head of the Federal Reserve, struck a resolute tone in a speech at the central bank’s most closely watched conference.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell, the head of the Federal Reserve, struck a resolute tone in a speech at the central bank’s most closely watched conference.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, pledged during a closely watched speech that his central bank would stick by its push to stamp out high inflation “until the job is done” and said that officials stood ready to raise interest rates further if needed.

articles.headline: A Crisis of Confidence Is Gripping China’s Economy
articles.snippet: China’s economy, which once seemed unstoppable, is plagued by a series of problems, and a growing lack of faith in the future is verging on despair.
articles.abstract: China’s economy, which once seemed unstoppable, is plagued by a series of problems, and a growing lack of faith in the future is verging on despair.
articles.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, David Yang was brimming with confidence about the prospects for his perfume factory in eastern China.
articles.byline: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Claire Fu
